item.title: Edward add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "...remember the ladies, and be more generous and favorable to them than your ancestors. Do not put such unlimited power into the hands of the Husbands. Remember all Men would be tyrants if they could. If particular care and attention is not paid to the Ladies we are determined to foment a Rebellion, and will not hold ourselves bound by any Laws in which we have no voice, or Representation." -- Abigail Adams

item.title: Edward add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "The creative is the place where no one else has ever been. You have to leave the city of your comfort and go into the wilderness of your intuition. What you'll discover will be wonderful. What you'll discover will be yourself." -- Alan Alda

item.title: Edward add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "Here's my Golden Rule for a tarnished age: Be fair with others, but keep after them until they're fair with you." -- Alan Alda

item.title: Edward add a quote by Alan Alda
item.description: "When people are laughing, they're generally not killing one another. " -- Alan Alda

item.title: Edward add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Dignity does not consist in possessing honors, but in the consciousness that we deserve them." -- Aristotle

item.title: Edward add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Edward add a quote by Evelyn Beatrice Hall
item.description: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it." -- Evelyn Beatrice Hall

item.title: Edward add a quote by Francois Marie Arouet
item.description: "Of all religions, the Christian should of course inspire the most tolerance, but until now Christians have been the most intolerant of all men." -- Francois Marie Arouet

item.title: Edward add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "If presidents can't do it to their wives, they do it to their country. " -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Edward add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State. ... These two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death." -- George Carlin

item.title: Edward add a quote by Lord Chesterfield
item.description: "Never seem more learned than the people you are with. Wear your learning like a pocket watch and keep it hidden. Do not pull it out to count the hours, but give the time when you are asked." -- Lord Chesterfield

item.title: Edward add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "I pass with relief from the tossing sea of Cause and Theory to the firm ground of Result and Fact." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Edward add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Show me a young Conservative and I'll show you someone with no heart. Show me an old Liberal and I'll show you someone with no brains." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Edward add a quote by Rene Descartes
item.description: "The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues." -- Rene Descartes

item.title: Edward add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Teaching should be such that what is offered is perceived as a valuable gift and not as hard duty. Never regard study as duty but as the enviable opportunity to learn to know the liberating influence of beauty in the realm of the spirit for your own personal joy and to the profit of the community to which your later work belongs." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Edward add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description:
"All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree. All these aspirations are directed toward ennobling man's life, lifting it from the sphere of mere physical existence and leading the individual towards freedom."
[<i>Moral Decay</i> (first published 1937)]" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Edward add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Edward add a quote by Anna Freud
item.description: "Sometimes the most beautiful thing is precisely the one that comes unexpectedly and unearned." -- Anna Freud

item.title: Edward add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "It goes without saying that a civilization which leaves so large a number of its participants unsatisfied and drives them into revolt neither has nor deserves the prospect of a lasting existence." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Edward add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Edward add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A jury consists of twelve persons chosen to decide who has the better lawyer." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Edward add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Edward add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Edward add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Edward add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Edward add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Edward add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Edward add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Edward add a quote by Homer
item.description: "Young men's minds are always changeable, but when an old man is concerned in a matter, he looks both before and after." -- Homer

item.title: Edward add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "The books we read should be chosen with great care, that they may be, as an Egyptian king wrote over his library,'The medicines of the soul." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
